form.official-title: To require a report relating to the Special Presidential Envoy for Climate.

section.header: Special Presidential Envoy for Climate reporting requirements

subsection.text: Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of State shall submit to the appropriate congressional committees a report on the following:

paragraph.text: Budget information detailing expenditures of the Special Presidential Envoy for Climate, during fiscal years 2021 and 2022.
The number of temporary and full-time employees currently working in the Office of the Special Presidential Envoy for Climate, including the names of all such full-time employees.
Information on the Special Presidential Envoy for Climate’s foreign travel, including—

subparagraph.text: carbon emissions from air travel, as required by Executive Order 14057; and
the dates, attendees, and discussion topics from all meetings with foreign leaders.

paragraph.text: the term “appropriate congressional committees” means the Committee on Foreign Affairs of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Foreign Relations of the Senate; and
the term “Office of the Special Presidential Envoy for Climate” means the staff, full-time employees, temporary employees, and contractors, supporting the Special Presidential Envoy for Climate.
